pr_title: Add methods for retrieving full paginator output token and item paths.

timeline.message: Add methods for retrieving full paginator output and item paths.

timeline.body:
This breaks a public method contract. This should be a new method, with updated documentation, instead of replacing the current one. If the old method shouldn't be used, it should be marked as `@deprecated`, its existing functionality routed through the new method, usages of it removed where possible, and explicit tests of its functionality added if not already present.

When splitting this out, the return type should just be a `List` instead of an `Optional<List<>>`. An empty list should indicate an unresolvable path, instead of needing to check both the `Optional` and `List` for emptiness. This will need to account for partially resolved paths as well, where leading segment(s) of the path are present but not all segments are present.

      *              of an operation.
      * @return The optional member shape that the path resolves to.

-    public static Optional<MemberShape> resolvePath(

changed_code.chunk:
@@ -86,13 +87,40 @@ public final class PaginatedTrait extends AbstractTrait implements ToSmithyBuild *

A path is a series of identifiers separated by dots (`.`) where each identifier * represents a member name in a structure. * - * @param path The path to resolve. + * @param path The path to resolve. * @param model The model to be searched when resolving the path. * @param shape The shape where path resolution should start, e.g. the output shape * of an operation. * @return The optional member shape that the path resolves to. + * @deprecated This method only returns the last {@link MemberShape} of an output path. To resolve each path + * identifier to it's respective {@link MemberShape} see {@link PaginatedTrait#resolvePathToMember} */ - public static Optional> resolvePath( + public static Optional resolvePath( + String path, + Model model, + StructureShape shape + ) { + List memberShapes = resolvePathToMember(path, model, shape); + if (memberShapes.size() == 0) { + return Optional.empty(); + } + return Optional.of(memberShapes.get(memberShapes.size() - 1)); + } + + /** + * Resolves an output path to a list of {@link MemberShape}. + * + *

A path is a series of identifiers separated by dots (`.`) where each identifier + * represents a member name in a structure. + * + * @param path The path to resolve. + * @param model The model to be searched when resolving the path. + * @param shape The shape where path resolution should start, e.g. the output shape + * of an operation. + * @return The list of member shapes corresponding to each path identifier. An unresolvable path will be returned + * as an empty list. + */ + public static List resolvePathToMember( String path, Model model, StructureShape shape

@@ -120,7 +121,7 @@ public final class PaginatedTrait extends AbstractTrait implements ToSmithyBuild
      * @return The list of member shapes corresponding to each path identifier. An unresolvable path will be returned
      * as an empty list.
      */
-    public static List<MemberShape> resolvePathToMember(
+    public static List<MemberShape> resolveFullPath(
             String path,
             Model model,
             StructureShape shape

timeline.body: The updates to this file should have tests, enforcing the behavior of the existing methods before the change (if none are present already around multi-segment paths) and the behavior of the new methods.

timeline.author: kstich

timeline.body:
Having a resolved output token is required for pagination, I think you can assume that size will be `>= 1`.

>[When contained within a service, a paginated operation MUST either configure outputToken on the operation itself or inherit it from the service that contains the operation.](https://awslabs.github.io/smithy/1.0/spec/core/behavior-traits.html#paginated-trait)
timeline.bodyText:
Having a resolved output token is required for pagination, I think you can assume that size will be >= 1.

When contained within a service, a paginated operation MUST either configure outputToken on the operation itself or inherit it from the service that contains the operation.
timeline.bodyHTML:
Having a resolved output token is required for pagination, I think you can assume that size will be >= 1.

When contained within a service, a paginated operation MUST either configure outputToken on the operation itself or inherit it from the service that contains the operation.

timeline.author: kstich

timeline.body:
The method names on these are inconsistent:

`getOutputTokenMember` -> `getOutputTokenPath`
`getItemsMember` -> `getItemsMemberPath`

Since the original names are intact, I'd make this one `getOutputTokenMemberPath`.

getItemsMember -> getItemsMemberPath
Since the original names are intact, I'd make this one getOutputTokenMemberPath.
